content:
# æŸ¥çœ‹æ–‡ç« åŸæ–‡å’Œå®Œæ•´æç¤ºè¯è¯·ç‚¹å‡» ğŸ‘‰ [å…­å¤§sora2 æç¤ºè¯æŠ€å·§](https://www.thesorawatermarkremover.com/posts/top-six-sora2-prompt-techniques-anime-prompt) éƒ¨åˆ†å†…å®¹è§ä¸‹ ---------- ## Table of Contents 1. [Introduction](#introduction) 2. [Technique 1: Nano Banana Pro Storyboard Generation](#technique-1-nano-banana-pro-storyboard-generation) 3. [Technique 2: Time-Stamped Prompts for Anime Creation](#technique-2-time-stamped-prompts-for-anime-creation) 4. [Technique 3: Image Collage as Input for Character Control](#technique-3-image-collage-as-input-for-character-control) 5. [Technique 4: MARS-LSP Prompt Template](#technique-4-mars-lsp-prompt-template) 6. [Technique 5: Interactive System Prompt for Sora2](#technique-5-interactive-system-prompt-for-sora2) 7. [Technique 6: Script Screenshot as Image Input](#technique-6-script-screenshot-as-image-input) 8. [Conclusion](#conclusion) 9. [About the Author](#about-the-author) ## Introduction Welcome to the ultimate guide on Sora2 prompt techniques! Whether you're looking for good sora2 prompts, seeking a sora2 prompt enhancer, or following a sora2 prompt guide, this article delivers practical, proven techniques with full prompt examples. Each technique has been tested and verified by leading AI video creators across X. ## Technique 1: Nano Banana Pro Storyboard Generation **Source:** [X Post by @SDXLHQ](https://x.com/SDXLHQ/status/1994964808761053690) | **Views:** 59,700

OMG this prompt hack from @yachimat_manga is straight fire ğŸ”¥

I tested it on various anime scenes and my brain exploded ğŸ¤¯!!

Drop img + prompt into NB2 â†’ 3x3 grid â†’ send to Sora = bangers in seconds ğŸ˜±â€¼ï¸

Try it yourself ğŸš€ #AIart #AI #SORA2 #NanoBananaPro https://t.co/Bk83KYMXED pic.twitter.com/hg0cg3esV6

— SD | AI Animation Storyteller (@SDXLHQ) November 30, 2025
This groundbreaking technique involves using Nano Banana Pro to generate storyboards, which are then used as image inputs for Sora2. This approach ensures that your videos strictly follow visual style, camera control, consistent characters, and consistent scenes. ### How It Works: 1. Generate a storyboard using Nano Banana Pro based on your concept 2. Use the resulting image as the reference input for Sora2 3. Add your detailed prompt to guide the animation 4. Sora2 will generate a video that closely follows the storyboard ### Full Workflow Example: ``` Drop img + prompt into NB2 â†’ 3x3 grid â†’ send to Sora = bangers in seconds - Use a detailed storyboard image showing character, environment, and key poses - Add specific animation instructions in the text prompt - Mention desired style, lighting, and mood ``` ### Nanobanana pro prompt (for storyboard generation) ``` Analyze the entire composition of the input image. Identify ALL key subjects present (whether it's a single person, a group/couple, a vehicle, or a specific object) and their spatial relationship/interaction. Generate a cohesive 3x3 grid "Cinematic Contact Sheet" featuring 9 distinct camera shots of exactly these subjects in the same environment. You must adapt the standard cinematic shot types to fit the content (e.g., if a group, keep the group together; if an object, frame the whole object): **Row 1 (Establishing Context):** 1. **Extreme Long Shot (ELS):** The subject(s) are seen small within the vast environment. 2. **Long Shot (LS):** The complete subject(s) or group is visible from top to bottom (head to toe / wheels to roof). 3. **Medium Long Shot (American/3-4):** Framed from knees up (for people) or a 3/4 view (for objects). **Row 2 (The Core Coverage):** 4. **Medium Shot (MS):** Framed from the waist up (or the central core of the object). Focus on interaction/action. 5. **Medium Close-Up (MCU):** Framed from chest up. Intimate framing of the main subject(s). 6. **Close-Up (CU):** Tight framing on the face(s) or the "front" of the object. **Row 3 (Details & Angles):** 7. **Extreme Close-Up (ECU):** Macro detail focusing intensely on a key feature (eyes, hands, logo, texture). 8. **Low Angle Shot (Worm's Eye):** Looking up at the subject(s) from the ground (imposing/heroic). 9. **High Angle Shot (Bird's Eye):** Looking down on the subject(s) from above. Ensure strict consistency: The same people/objects, same clothes, and same lighting across all 9 panels. The depth of field should shift realistically (bokeh in close-ups). A professional 3x3 cinematic storyboard grid containing 9 panels. The grid showcases the specific subjects/scene from the input image in a comprehensive range of focal lengths. **Top Row:** Wide environmental shot, Full view, 3/4 cut. **Middle Row:** Waist-up view, Chest-up view, Face/Front close-up. **Bottom Row:** Macro detail, Low Angle, High Angle. All frames feature photorealistic textures, consistent cinematic color grading, and correct framing for the specific number of subjects or objects analyzed. ``` This technique is particularly valuable for sora2 anime prompts, allowing for consistent character design and fluid animation sequences.

Transform any image with AI-powered processing. Upscale, enhance, colorize, restore, and more.

Features:

ğŸš€ Multiple Processing Modes: Upscale, unblur, colorize, sharpen, restore old photos, enhance images
âš¡ Real-time Progress: SSE-based status push, no page refresh needed

ğŸ¨ Multiple AI Models: Choose from Beta/V1/V2 models for different quality needs
ğŸ”¢ Flexible Scaling: Support 2x, 4x, 8x, 16x upscaling
ğŸ†“ Free to Use: First image free, no sign-up required
ğŸ“± Cross-platform: Works on mobile and desktop
ğŸ”’ Privacy Protected: Auto-cleanup after processing

Tech Stack:

Next.js 15 + React 19
TypeScript
Prisma + MySQL
Cloudflare R2 Storage
Replicate API (AI Models)
SSE (Server-Sent Events) for real-time updates

Technical Highlights:

Replaced polling with SSE, reducing latency from seconds to milliseconds
Network requests reduced from 15+ to 1 (for 30s processing time)
Automatic reconnection and error handling
Efficient state management with React Context

## âœ¨ æ ¸å¿ƒç‰¹æ€§ - ğŸ§© **è‡ªåŠ¨å‘ç°ä¸åŒæ­¥**ï¼šè‡ªåŠ¨ä»æ‰€æœ‰å·²æ³¨å†Œçš„ MCP Server è·å–å·¥å…·æ¸…å•ä¸æœ€æ–° schemaã€‚ - âš™ï¸ **ç»Ÿä¸€è°ƒç”¨æœºåˆ¶**ï¼šç»Ÿä¸€æ¥å£ä¾› LLM å‘å‡ºè°ƒç”¨è¯·æ±‚ï¼ŒHost è´Ÿè´£æ‰§è¡Œå¹¶è¿”å›ç»“æœï¼Œæ— éœ€ç”¨æˆ·æ‰‹å†™ glue codeã€‚ - ğŸ”€ **å¤š Server ç¼–æ’**ï¼šæ”¯æŒåŒæ—¶æ¥å…¥å¤šä¸ª MCP Serverï¼Œæ— ç¼ç®¡ç†ã€‚ - ğŸ–¥ï¸ **å¯è§†åŒ–æ§åˆ¶é¢æ¿ (UI)**ï¼šé€šè¿‡ Web UI ç®¡ç† Serverã€å¯ç”¨ï¼ç¦ç”¨å·¥å…·ã€æŸ¥çœ‹å·¥å…·æ¸…å•ä¸è°ƒç”¨æ—¥å¿—ã€‚ - ğŸ“¦ **å¿«é€Ÿä¸Šæ‰‹**ï¼šå¼€ç®±å³ç”¨ï¼Œé€‚é…ä»»æ„ç¬¦åˆ MCP æ ‡å‡†çš„æœåŠ¡ + ä¸»æµ LLMã€‚ ## ğŸ’»ä»£ç ç¤ºä¾‹ ```python import os import json from dotenv import load_dotenv from openai import OpenAI from mcp_host import MCPHost # å¼•å…¥ MCP Host load_dotenv(override=False) client = OpenAI(base_url=os.getenv("LLM_BASE_URL"), api_key=os.getenv("LLM_API_KEY")) model = os.getenv("LLM_MODEL") host = MCPHost() # 0.åˆå§‹åŒ– Hostï¼ˆèšåˆä¸è·¯ç”±å·¥å…·ï¼‰ tools = host.list_all_tools() # 1.è¯»å–å¯ç”¨æœåŠ¡å™¨çš„å·¥å…·æ³¨å†Œè¡¨ guide = host.tools_guide(tools) # 2.ç”Ÿæˆå‚æ•°æŒ‡å—ä¾›å¤§æ¨¡å‹å‚è€ƒ user_msg = input("è¯·è¾“å…¥æ¶ˆæ¯: ").strip() sys_prompt = ( "ä½ æ˜¯äººå·¥æ™ºèƒ½åŠ©æ‰‹ã€‚å¯ä½¿ç”¨ MCP å·¥å…·ã€‚è‹¥éœ€è¦è°ƒç”¨å·¥å…·ï¼Œ" "è¯·ä»…è¾“å‡ºå¦‚ä¸‹æ ¼å¼æ–‡æœ¬ï¼š{\n\t\"type\": \"function\",\n\t\"name\": \"<å·¥å…·å>\",\n\t\"parameters\": {â€¦}\n}ã€‚" "ä»¥ä¸‹ä¸ºå„å·¥å…·çš„ä½¿ç”¨è¯´æ˜ï¼š\n" + guide ) first = client.chat.completions.create( model=model, messages=[ {"role": "system", "content": sys_prompt}, {"role": "user", "content": user_msg}, ], ) content = first.choices[0].message.content or "" has_tool, spec = host.detect_tool(content) # 3.ä»å¤§æ¨¡å‹è¾“å‡ºè§£æ æŒ‡ä»¤ JSON if has_tool: tool_result = host.call_tool(spec, formated=True) # 4.æ‰§è¡Œå·¥å…·è°ƒç”¨å¹¶è¿”å›æ ¼å¼åŒ–ç»“æœ second = client.chat.completions.create( model=model, messages=[ {"role": "system", "content": sys_prompt}, {"role": "user", "content": user_msg}, {"role": "assistant", "content": content}, {"role": "system", "content": "" + tool_result + " è¯·åŸºäºå·¥å…·ç»“æœç”¨ä¸­æ–‡å›å¤ç”¨æˆ·ã€‚"}, ], ) print(second.choices[0].message.content or "") else: print(content) ```
